page.title: 15SPECIAL EDUCATION WASHINGTON
page.content: {Usworth Colliery Unit for partially {hearing children}has infant and junior departments, each consisting of about 10 children. There are 2 specialist teachers. Some children go to the {Usworth Secondary School Unit,}founded in 1978, which has 7 pupils and is run by a specialist teacher. The children use computers, hearing aids and radio microphones. The school also has a{Warnock Unit,}for pupils with{moderate learning difficulties from Sunderland Borough. Classes are very small and the pupils are offered a wide curriculum by the 2 teachers. {Wellbank School,}opened in 1983, was built after the Warnock Report to provide for the{special educational needs of children 14-17 years old living in Washington and Felling. 12 teachers instruct 97 children.
